    • Method Detail

      • findOverriddenMethods

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> findOverriddenMethods(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        The method finds all overridden methods by the specified method, in such an order that, overridden methods declared in interfaces > the ones declared in super classes > the ones declared in super class' interfaces, etc. The method does not support methods with generic parameter types, nor does it support finding overridden methods with generic parameter types... yet. Simply because matching generic signatures at runtime using reflection is so tedious, and the inheritance hierarchy has so many possible cases to handle, it (potentially) requires large amount of work, crazy recursive logic and careful design.
        Parameters:
        method - the method to find overridden methods for, cannot be null or static.
        Returns:
        the list of overridden methods found, or empty list if none found, never returns null.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when method is null or static.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if method has generic type parameters.

      • predicateParametersAnnotatedWith

        public static java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> predicateParametersAnnotatedWith(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> annotationType)
